clues.clue: Among the ingredients in Julia Child's "basic" this: vinegar (duh), olive oil, shallots & Dijon mustard

Giada De Laurentiis puts shallots in a pilaf made not with rice, but rather with thisgrain grown high in the Andes
In "Joy of Cooking", Irma Rombauer doesn't use shallots for these Rockefeller, but does for them Casino

In Japanese tani is valley; yama is this
In Portuguese these 2 antonyms are cedo & tarde
Afrikaaners can tell you this is Dutch for "farmer"
The ability to say or do the right thing with grace, it's French for "to know how to do"

final_jeopardy.clue: This title, launched in early 1930, seemed at odds with the Great Depression in subject & $1 cover price
